Hello J. B. Rainsberger,

On Friday, May 26, 2006, 8:57:09 PM, you wrote:

>> kul991 wrote:
>> Can i create stubs to simulate method calls to internal/external
>> methods called from a method M1 while writing a test class to test the
>> method M1?
>> 
>> Stubs are created automatically in JTest but i wanted to know if there
>> is a method to create stubs on our own using plain JUnit.

>> JTest creates /test/ stubs, meaning placeholders for tests you might 
>> want to write. I find those stubs not to be very useful or helpful, but 
>> that's just one man's opinion.

>> As for simulated method calls, you should look at JMock.

Another very nice library for that is EasyMock v2.2. I have been using
it for 2 weeks now and did not encounter a single problem. It is worth
considering.


-- 
Regards,
Ivan Milosavljevic, BSc                  mailto:ivan.mile@...
